meanings.definition: A person who undervalues or underestimates something.
meanings.sent1: The misprizer thought the painting was worthless, but others found it beautiful.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a misprizer and appreciate the effort put into this handmade gift.
meanings.sent3: The misprizer couldn't see the value in the old book, not realizing it was a rare first edition.
meanings.sent4: She was a misprizer of talent, unable to recognize the potential in young artists.
meanings.sent5: Being a misprizer of nature, he failed to see the beauty in the simple flower.

meanings.sent1: It is not right to misprize the hard work she puts into her studies.
meanings.sent2: Do not misprize the importance of kindness in making a difference.
meanings.sent3: He tends to misprize his own abilities, not realizing how talented he truly is.
meanings.sent4: She misprized the value of the antique vase, not knowing it was a rare artifact.
meanings.sent5: Never misprize the power of a kind word to brighten someone's day.
